Title: NEVER JOIN RISK PROFILE IN SEMBCORP INDIA
Pro: Work life balance since there will be no work and all life
Con:
The cons are specific to the risk management profile in SEIL. The company otherwise is doing amazing business in renewable business in India. Talking of Risk Team, there are several reason for not joining this team: (1) Repetitive Tasks - the task performed are already work done of either commercial or corporate finance team. The team takes inputs from various teams, put the information in a PPT and forward to the board. there is no value addition of any sort except how to make lengthy ppts. (2) No direct contribution to company's balance sheet/PL (hence dont except decent increments) (3) Lethargy at the core of the team - there are no deadlines, no follow ups, no discussions, no accountability of any sorts. I was not handed over the basic documents relating to the work till 5th month from joining. (4) Unprofessional and Politics - The team have people who are in the system for the past 10-12 years, who are highly unprofessional, lacks knowledge of sector and they are very toxic. Being in system for so long they have taken over the whatever work the team gets. They will not share with some one new who joins - hence no work, no contribution, and no recognition

PLS DONT JOIN THIS TEAM. IT WILL IMPACT YOUR CAREER IN LONG RUN. I LEFT IN 6 MONTHS AFTER SUFFERING ALL OF THIS. AFTER PUTTING RESIGNATION THE ENTIRE TEAM LITERALLY HAD A WITCH-HUNT TRYING TO ACCUSE ME OF THINGS BECAUSE IN MY CONVERSATION WITH THE HR (POST RESIGNATION) I EXPLAINED HER MYREASON OF LEAVING IN A SHORT DURATION (6 MONTHS) "NO WORK ASSIGNED BY THE TEAM"

Title: Great opportunities for growth but workforce tends to be a bit overstretched
Pro: great colleagues and diverse portfolio
Con:
high turnover of employees

very modest yearly increment

Title: Working in Sembcorp
Pro: Definitely a good place to learn and build things for the organization that is going through transformation. People with other MNC experience could use their skills and experience that the company can put to good use the talents brought in to bring the company to another level.
Con: A very typical SG T-link culture that people from the western MNCs may not be able to adapt to....

Title: Old school management
Pro: Welfare is ok, bonus has been good.
Con:
Old school thinking and alot of people who are inefficient. Probably good for a retirement job but not very exciting for a young/middle age employees

Appears to be reactive in terms of policies, something has to happen before gaps are began to be plugged. Policies are very outdated as well and people are not receptive to changes.

Title: Change of CEO & Now back to old backwards old school mentality
Pro: Temasek backed so not going to fail. Stable for singapore environment. Good place if you want to retire here. Just have to ride out the waves of change every 3-5 years, go forwards and then backwards again. If you can live with this then great for you.
Con:
Change of CEO who has more local mentality and who brings in his own entourage and an “interesting” chief operating & HR officer who does not seem to support diversity policies based in his comment at some meeting. We are regressing and reversing all the projects we have been working on for last 3 years. Restructuring whole teams for cost cutting but no improvement on systems or process while expecting everything to improve on efficiency. Basically asking us employees to more with no real support.
All senior management change again. Not sure this bunch know what is needed to improve company. like all soldiers of CEO. Good and bad, should be less in flighting but till that day comes many changes. No longer stable place.

Title: Sembcorp In a Nut Shell -Power plant
Pro:
Pros:
•If you are ok with paper work, sembcorp wants you. 
•OTs pay are good.
•Being in Operation team will be the best option to succeed in Sembcorp. 
•Working in HQ will be a better option.
Con:
Here’s are the cons: (In a Nut Shell)
•No proper training provided but expect a lot from you
•No buddy system, you are on your own. No guide as everyone is basically being selfish. No sharing of knowledge
• Messy culture, HR are useless as they are too busy catering events to HQ. 
•Safety team are messy, always have so many ridiculous implementation. Do note you need to hold the railing while climbing the stairs. 
•Micro Management, getting from bad to worst. 
•OTs are being controlled, need permission to work on weekends. Have 0 trust on us on managing our OTs. 
•Way to many documentation to be done before a job can be carried out
•Management have a academia but i have no idea what are they doing. They have this pilot courses but is being taught by seniors managers who can’t teach and converse well in English. Can’t afford to provide a proper training that involves the work here like understanding the system, SAP etc.

Title: In transition
Pro:
1. In industries with strong tailwinds after shedding Marine business 
2. Has strong Temasek backing
Con:
1. Undergoing change right now, probably more changes coming up
2. The trend of recent top and senior management changes including CEO, CFO, CDO, CHRO, two business line heads, and two market heads is a cause for concern. This signals upcoming periods of instability as their replacements take the requisite time to learn the organization nuances, and along the way make novice mistakes to change for the sake of changing and listen to one-sided siloed guidance. 
3. Deeper issues include HR department is totally new. As HR holds an essential role to bind the staff together to the central vision of the company through thick and thin, particularly so during times of transition, it is tough to do so if the team is totally new.

Title: Continually declining used to be good
Pro: I have seen IT team building from just networks and legacy software's to Digital and Technology with Data Sciences Al and up to date platforms. Culture was great and diversity in culture was welcomed.
Con: Things changed drasticly... employees are not trusted anymore.  Instead vendors are asked to complain about company staff! All senior management removed in 40 days of new leadership.  People are frustrated and leaving. IT department is running on 60% capacity (high attrition) as compare to month of May.

Title: executive
Pro: there is no need for any pros comments over here as not worth working so hard and yet gain nothing.just gain rubbish and frustration.

Title: Poor Management, old fashion culture, low pay & increment
Pro: "8 months Bonus" is claimed to be the biggest advantages/attraction for working in this company which becomes an valid excuse for the company to do a big pay cut for u.
Con:
Management is using “bonus" as a weapon to threaten employees to work massive overtime no matter you have finished your work or not.
What they like to say is "if you do not work overtime, don't complain if you get only 1-2 months bonus"
In fact, the bonus declared is just a show to public where the real bonus given is 1-3 months lesser than the announced amount. 
Very less increment- the increment is only $50-100 per year (depends whether your boss likes u or not)
Less chance for promotion- promotion is based on the number of working years not capability, so it ends up with having seniors/managers having lesser knowledge than juniors.

Title: Coating Inspecor
Pro:
	Attend all inspections such as after blasting substrate profile check, salt level check, DFT check as per the specification.
	 Responsible for incoming coating/ painting material inspection and has to ensure whether these materials suits to meet the requirements of project specification.
	Perform all inspection as per the ITP to verify the requirement.
	Take daily readings of conditions such as: Humidity, Dew Point and Surface Temperature.
	Co-ordinate with client daily basis to resolve any Quality issues/paint failures & provides solutions.
	Carrying out visual inspection after coating.
	Taking part in the determination of corrective actions and then ensuring the correct implementation of the activities for resolving cases of nonconformity.
	Co-ordination with the third party inspection as well as client inspection as per the Project Specifications & Standards.
Con:
	Before painting application (surface preparation, cleanliness degree, surface roughness, salt contamination measurement, surface defects, blasting abrasives)
	Handle various instruments for Coating, visual inspection of abrasive, grit, garnet, blasting/ painting / coating by using following measuring instruments: Digital Dew Point Calculator, Surface Profile Gauge with and Replica Tape, Wet Film Thickness Gauge & Dry Film Thickness Gauge, surface profile Comparator, Hypodermic Needle Gauge.
	Check calibration certificate for all painting inspection equipment.
	After Painting application (check DFT, adhesions and painting defects)
	Check calibration certificates for all painting inspection equipment.

Title: There seems to be some inherent problems.
Pro:
Very family like working relationship people are friendly. 
Close proximity to mrt station as compared to other shipyards.
Good bonus but they are not to last. 
Good place to learn ship repair and installation from the experts.
Independent learning and adaptation to responsibility, but a little too much.
Con:
Low basic salary and very slow salary growth.
Does not retain talents, does not inspire talents to stay.
Scope of work for each department not well defined.
Too much tolerant for incompetent people. 
Learning is sometimes suppressed by incompetent people who just wants new people to be responsible for things they dont know. 
Career progression is different or suppressed in certain departments.
Receptible to feedbacks but takes no action to cost effective and productive improvement suggestions.
Too short lunch hours and  not allowed to have lunch outside of lunch hours.

Title: Mixed feelings about this company. Sometimes I miss it a lot, though I don't regret leaving it.
Pro: Good bonus; most colleagues and bosses are competent,; nice and friendly; good team bonding; steady career progress
Con: Occasionally need to work with colleague / bosse who are not capable of delivering their own works. Top heavy structure.

Title: Good training ground for entry level managers
Pro: Strong brand name. Good training ground with a diversified business portfolio. Less bureaucratic than most MNCs.
Con: Below market level compensation. Too many mid-high level managers, making it difficult for entry level managers to progress in the company. Lack of visibility on career progression.

Title: Talk much, do little
Pro: variable bonus better than market
Con:
Incompetent team who can talk but cannot execute. Rely heavily on vendors to do the work for them. Evan after trainings, people are not able to be independent.
New hires are all Assistant VP and above, and those who are promoted are only good at selling themselves. Top heavy management and very little people can do the actual work.

Title: interesting place
Pro:
the money from bonus is good (not so much currently due factors beyond our control due to the poor market) 
world renowned shipyard
variety of projects to work on
repair shipyard
good top management
Con:
despite having good top management, the middle managers are of relatively poor quality due to the lack of talent retention
long hours (if you work smart and finish your responsibilities early instead of doing overtime, you are deemed as not productive/lazy)
low basic
low increment
performance review which is not transparent

Title: It's a relaxing work env
Pro:
office setting very family like
work time very fixed
fast promotion if you got what the company wants. great personal career development.
Con:
as engineer you have to deal with all kinds of weather
work location far from urban area, have to go down to the only food court on jurong island to fetch lunch
you don't get to see ceo often

Title: SME company disguised as global MNC
Pro: good bonus, flexibility in terms of working hours, perceived as leader in some of the group's business
Con:
poor management culture and attitude towards people development, 
too focused on short term gains over big picture (buzzwods in the mouth of middle management is "cut cost, cut cost!") such that staff morale and confidence in the company is severly compromised, 
overwhelmed with people from certain nationalities such that Singaporeans are minorities. 
While official work language is still English, pretty much most of the time, the effective language used is another, general sense of professionalism of the staff is questionable. 
Middle management is effectively useless and are poor people managers in general

Title: Ok place to work...
Pro:
Huge bonus payouts annually in March, including share options. 

Flexi-work hours, you can select what time you arrive at work, and end accordingly 9 hours later.

Good work life balance, where supervisors respect your privacy and do not disturb you while you are on leave.
Con:
Micro-managers are abound and love to micro-manage some staff.

Slow to implement suggestions and embrace new ideas from staff who joined in from external companies.

Lacking the professional image seen in other MNCs. Could be down to the dressing of the senior management, where you can walk past them and not be able to tell that they are actually holding positions of Senior Vice Presidents.

Slow pay rise, averaging 3-5% annually.

Title: Best Company with Great Learning experiences
Pro:
I have been employed at Sembcorp for the past 5 years and the Sembcorp management is very Helpful in the Growth.
Good Colleagues and good working condition
Con: Some Politics which might ruin the Spirit of the Employees

Title: Typical chinaman company
Pro: good for fresh grad to experience the culture of one of the worst company to work with
Con:
- benefits is really bad, no medical insurance 
- gossip as favor is the culture here
- colleague backstab each other whenever can
- promotion is based on tenure , not merit
- stay late for the sake of staying late
- management is lazy, never do anything and micro manage
- lots of meeting but no actions
- those who are lazy will not need to do anything, those who are hardworking will need to cover the work of those who are lazy
- your superior will arrange your workload based on 24/7 working hour.
   -- everyday at 9am, your superior will assign you tasks to complete by 5pm.
   -- then everday at 5pm your superior will give you new tasks to complete by 9am the next day
   -- on every Friday 5pm, your superior will give you new tasks to complete by 9am the next Monday

Title: Looks more promising from the outside
Pro: Good work-life balance for most job functions. The company is also open to internal transfers, if there are openings and if your boss is supportive of the move. Big focus on operations, which are stable. Great if you are wanting just another job to cruise along. If you are ambitious, make sure they identify you as a high-potential staff, else forget about getting anywhere.
Con: No real in-house training and development programmes, so you have to look out for yourself, and hope that your boss approves.

Title: Great company with nice bosses.
Pro: This place has a great culture and a decently-sized office. The bosses are also nice, though they can come across as cold at times. Nevertheless, I think that working in this company is quite good.
Con: The management structure is quite tall and things can get quite bureaucratic in this company. Red-tapes are abound and it can take months before a suggestion gets followed through.

Title: This is best place where you can learn the trades core values you belong to..
Pro: Working environment, Safety, Security and the most important is friendly behaviour of top management.
Con: Go up to your next level or position is not so easy over this company, You need to work very very hard to achieve that.

Title: OK if you are not really ambitious
Pro:
Plant is really great, lots of opportunities to learn as engineers. 
With plants on multiple continents, you have exposure to multiple technologies
quality work
Con:
Painfully slow (very common in power)
Sometimes you just dont have any work to do
There is no formal introduction/induction/training  - you go to the plant talk to people and ask for work (not sure if this is a con for everybody)

Title: Sembcorp Gayatri power ltd review
Pro: Learning experience, good hr policies, solid infrastructure, organised timing, relatively better pay, foreign travel, timely salary deposit, good township, personal loan facility
Con: Bad management structure, psychological harrassment, no issue reporting & handling team, abrupt changes in hr policies, long notice period to junior team.

Title: Life as an intern is good, but not so much for a perm staff.
Pro: Lots of learning opportunities, fantastic colleagues who will become your lifelong friends. HR is quite helpful and honest about opportunities and future prospects.
Con: Management does not understand the workload of staff. Distribution of work is also very uneven, OT is the norm for some while for others is rare. Job scope between departments are also not defined, resulting in a lot of "pushing" of responsibilities around.

Title: Not for those who are starting out on their careers...
Pro: Family oriented organization for mid-career professionals and above, stable job even when economy is not doing well. Good compensation when market is booming.
Con: Does not value and retain talent and who you know is more important than what you know. A lot of politics, especially among the mid and top management. Difficult to gain good experience if you are starting out in your career, limited opportunities for junior staff to get involved in good projects.

Title: Initially, overwhelming, but once you get used to the work culture and hours, it is satisfying at the end of each day.
Pro: The people are like family, opportunity for career growth is almost limitless, there are numerous departments to explore your potential in.
Con: Very challenging physically and mentally. Working on weekends is the "norm". Project-based work may stretch for long periods of time and requires very close attention and coordination

Title: Not worth your time there.
Pro:
- people are generally okay.

Experience is from Engineering Department. (Design Office)

- senior design engineers, or even those more years there are lacking in knowledge to teach.
- department forces you to input overtime sheet everyday. If you need to leave on time at 5.30pm, you will be questioned by your lead. Should you have some commitment on Saturdays, you will also be questioned for not coming and writing down on the over time sheet. Basically, you need to overtime to be seen as "working".
- Canteen only has one store, nothing else. If you do not drive, be prepared to eat there  for your work-life. 
-Not allowed to place any personal stuff even standing calender on the table partition. You will be asked to remove it. 
- No one helps you to clear your desk litter bin. You have to clear it yourself.  
- Seniors cannot teach you much because they do not know much as well. Basically you have to figure out your self. 
- No internet access for six months until probation is over. For work purposes, you may need to justify fully why you need it.
- The company only practice one early dismissal yearly on christmas eve. You can leave at 3pm. Other than that, Chinese New Year eve or New year's eve, it is full work day. 
- Feedback are not taken seriously. You will feel a waste of time during those formal feedback session.
- Courses are all conducted in house. There is a training center that trains people. The trainer is the same trainer for many of the courses that you will go though. You do not get direct training from real industry trainers. So courses are nothing exciting or good about due to the lack of real industry lesson. 
- low pay rise. 
- bonus average 3-4 months.

Title: Executive
Pro: Work life balance and family oriented
Con: Micro managing management style

Title: There are definitely much better companies out there
Pro:
i) Not much overtime
ii) User expectations from some departments are low
iii) Good bonus payout
Con:
i) Bad benefits: Too little annual leave days, too low a monthly base pay
ii) Double standards in policies: Claims are allowed based on HR policies, but NOT encouraged by management. Stinginess is apparent in the entire company culture. Some departments do not need to have MC submitted but some do.
iii) Confusing procedures: Most of the time, middle management has no idea what is the proper process to follow. For e.g. project initiation. templates used for any form of documentation have not been updated regularly, and sometimes there are too many versions of the same document. The result is a mess of documentation submitted to various sources.
iv) Dependency on relationships rather than processes: If you are a people person with good PR skills, you would do well to survive there. But if not, too bad. Nothing will get done.
v) Middle and top management has no idea on the workload of their subordinates: They fail to understand how to measure the workload of the bottom-tier employees. There is a culture of just appointing work whenever they come without the understanding of resource capacity. The end result is a "work-pushing" culture due to self-defence.
vi) Management has traditional mindset and are not open minded to new ways of thinking: These are people who have been working there for over 10-20 years and believe they are elites. Times have changed, yet their minds have not. Be prepared to humor them at the expense of your dignity or have a difficult time working there.
vii) Don't let the news fool you: Lots of good news about the company recently due to their thriving business. But under the sparkling surface lies a pool of darkness. Lots of employees will leave after the performance bonus is distributed.

Title: Challenging environment with good learning experiences depending on how you look at it
Pro: Being through and surviving the company’s environment, culture and working system will definitely shape a stronger side of you. Beside this, it is a heaven for people with no aspirations, deluding in the past glory (which is at least 30 years ago) with no improve, and ones who want to retire here.
Con:
Safety

No standard safety yard stick throughout all repair vessels or projects, no even the basic ones. Safety here heavily depends on this “Safety starts with you(your budget)  and me (my profit)”.

 

Mentorship / Guidance

Management or depts manager do not know how to guide and groom the young. Many of them are experiences personal who spend years (long long years) on the ground learning. Their mindset are set in the similar way as their era – explore yourself in the deep ocean, see it yourself, not explaination. Even when they try to explain, it will end up as a session of boosting how good they are and how many difficult situation they solved.

Employee benefit / Concern

Management is not concern with employee working life balance, and to instill the family value of the company in you. Department annual gathering and Xmas party is the only events they have for you. What’s more! You got to play for it ranging from $80 to $150, workers too ($20-50). Imagine hows much workers are earning?

Food here sucks! 42min of lunch time (1230 to 1312). But you can only leave office at 1230? Imagine quening the only 2 stalls in the yard each for contracts and yard personal? at least 10-15min gone....To reach office by 1310 for meeting (5mins to cycle back) how much time are you left for food!?

If not, pack your lunch and eat....(5mins) and rest to sleep...

 Environment Concern

All environment programs are just for show. It can be a super good one but not budget or someone to make it happens.
A company with not much social responsibility.
So contracting with you see mediacorp cleaning the beach.
